channel.title: Battery Question
channel.description:
Alright, a cord on my battery for an airsoft gun snapped. I don't really know how, but I don't think I can get a replacement from AirSplat. I can try splicing the wires if possible, but I am wondering if I can use a battery from AirSplat as the old battery.
The battery that was being used in the gun:
AC/DC ADAPTOR Model:CH-4114A INPUT:AC 110V 50Hz OUTPUT:DC 8.4V 250mA
That is the charger, which hooks up to a battery pack that has the label:
1100mAh 2/3a 1100mAh 1.2V
I am wondering about this battery:
http://www.airsplat.com/Items/AC-BC-ELE-…
6V -12V 1,000 mAh (1 Amp Airsoft Battery Pack Charger 1-3 hours to fully charge an airsoft battery Charge all types of batteries - Compatible with Large and Small Tamiya Plug Self Adjusting Charger for Airsoft Batteries from 6V to 12V Very Economic Option for Airsoft Battery Charger
Could I use that charger to charge my 1100mAh battery? If not, does anyone have a suggestion?

item.title: Battery Question
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

That is the label on the adapter that plugs into the wall, then you hook up the batteries into the plug-in. Does the adapter I want to buy sound alright?

Read full topic

item.title: Battery Question
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Teh Spede:

l0l guys… There is 7 of those 1.2 volt thingys in the battery thus making it 8.4v. ^^[/quote][quote=“Chassy13, post:1, topic:301291”]OUTPUT:DC 8.4V 250mA

Is this it? If so, that is the charger, not the battery pack.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

l0l guys… There is 7 of those 1.2 volt thingys in the battery thus making it 8.4v. ^^

item.title: Battery Question
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:1, topic:301291”]Charge all types of batteries

  • Compatible with Large and Small Tamiya Plug
    Self Adjusting Charger for Airsoft Batteries from 6V to 12V
    Very Economic Option for Airsoft Battery Charger

Could I use that charger to charge my 1100mAh battery? If not, does anyone have a suggestion?[/quote]

You might be able to use this charger to charge your 1100mAh battery since it does say that it charges all types of batteries.

Read full topic

item.title: Battery Question
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Is it even possible to plug 8.4V into a 1.2V battery without fucking it up?

Read full topic

item.title: Battery Question
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

RXVL:

Are you sure the battery is 1.2 Volts?

That’s what is says on the actual battery that plugs into the gun.

Read full topic
